articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Celtic forward Daizen Maeda has explained just how important coach Harry Kewell has been to his upturn in fortunes.
articles.title: Daizen Maeda reveals key Celtic man who helped him through 'difficult weeks and months'

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: The World Cup gets underway on Sunday when Qatar face Ecuador in one of the least exciting games to ever kick off the tournament. However, just over 24 hours later will see the first SPFL interest.
articles.title: Celtic, Hearts and Rangers stars amongst Premiership 7 in World Cup transfer shop window

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Celtic play their second friendly in Australia as part of the Sydney Super Cup in the early hours of Sunday morning when they face Premier League side Everton.
articles.title: What channel is Celtic v Everton on? Kick-off time change, TV details, team news for Sydney Super Cup clash

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Celtic could add a centre-back in the January transfer window with the J1 League set to be exploited once more.
articles.title: Celtic get huge signing encouragement after key target's club make contract admission

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Scotland starlet is being lined up by a Premier League club for a January loan move after making his debut for Liverpool and impressing for his country’s under-21s.
articles.title: Ben Doak: Liverpool and Scotland starlet wanted by EPL side in surprise loan move

articles.author: Jamie Gardner
articles.description: FIFA president Gianni Infantino took aim at European critics of Qatar on the eve of the World Cup in an extraordinary hour-long monologue.
articles.title: FIFA chief Gianni Infantino slams European criticism of Qatar in controversial speech on eve of World Cup

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Everton boss Frank Lampard has insisted he pays no attention to speculation amid rumours linking Ange Postecoglou as his possible replacement at Goodison Park.
articles.title: Frank Lampard responds to rumours linking Celtic's Ange Postecoglou with Everton job

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Charlie Mulgrew will combine playing for Dundee United with a coaching role as part of Liam Fox’s management team.
articles.title: Dundee United hand Charlie Mulgrew player-coach role as Liam Fox pinpoints star's professionalism

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Scottish football authorities have warned that banning alcohol advertising from football matches could have “significant unintended consequences” for the game.
articles.title: SPFL chief Neil Doncaster warns alcohol advertising ban could be 'extremely grave' for Scottish football

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: Scotland Under-21 boss Scot Gemmill hailed Liverpool’s Ben Doak but said that his side had to learn lessons after Iceland gave them a timely reminder of the standards needed at this level.
articles.title: Liverpool's Ben Doak 'on treatment table after taking sore one' for Scotland Under-21s

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: The hype around Ben Doak continues to build after the Liverpool starlet stood out in Scotland Under-21s’ 2-1 defeat to Iceland in a friendly at Fir Park.
articles.title: Ben Doak: Liverpool star earns 'superstar potential' review from fans for Scotland U-21s performance

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: This may have been a makeshift side, with several Scotland players brought in at this level for the first time, but it was still one comprising quality.
articles.title: Ben Doak the star attraction as Liverpool youngster shines despite Scotland Under-21s defeat to Iceland

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Celtic defender Anthony Ralston confessed that expected standards failed to be met by Ange Postecoglou’s men in the 2-1 loss over Sydney FC and the nature of the competition does not make that fact any more palatable.
articles.title: 'No excuse for that' - Celtic let down Australian fans with Sydney showing, admits Anthony Ralston

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Since Ange Postecoglou walked into Lennoxtown, a key part of the success in reinvigorating a club which had witnessed the dream of ten in a row foiled by their greatest rivals has been in the transfer window.
articles.title: Celtic transfers: 4 areas where Postecoglou could strengthen, making January look easy and the demanding role

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou refused to consider the patchwork nature of the starting line-up he selected could offer any mitigation for the desperate nature of his team’s display in their 2-1 loss to Sydney FC.
articles.title: 'Brilliant' Celtic fans praised but Ange Postecoglou makes 'well off it' admission after Sydney defeat

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: There was a moment about half an hour in to Celtic’s first Sydney Super Cup encounter when the camera panned to a close up of Ange Postecoglou.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou left shaking his head as Celtic fail to impress in Sydney Super Cup opener

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Ange Postecoglou has revealed he loves what he is doing at Celtic and “couldn't be happier” amidst speculation of interest from elsewhere.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou in Celtic job declaration after Everton and Japan links as club target two in transfer window

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Scotland manager Steve Clarke believes the quick turnaround from arriving in Turkey to taking the pitch in Diyarbakır could be factored in as an “excuse” for his team’s 2-1 friendly loss that brought to an end a four-game unbeaten run.
articles.title: Steve Clarke points to 'excuses' which factored into Scotland's poor opening hour in defeat to Turkey

articles.description: Many trends have been bucked by Steve Clarke across his three-and-a-half years in charge of Scotland.

articles.description: Scottish football clubs across the men’s and women’s game will don their away colours next month as the SPFL and SWPL unite to help combat homelessness.

articles.description: Scottish Premiership manager Jim Goodwin is ‘confident’ that Celtic will not recall Liam Scales from his loan in the January transfer window. articles.title: 'In contact...' - SPFL manager drops interesting January claim on 'outstanding' Celtic loanee

McGregor […]
articles.title: 'Great to see...' - McAvennie delighted at one thing he's noticed behind the scenes at Celtic

articles.description: Celtic are ready to move for a new full-back and a striker in the New Year, according to The Daily Record’s Mark Pirie. The Lowdown: Celtic’s summer business The club were busy over the summer when it comes to incomings, with three previous loan moves made permanent. Parkhead officials also brought in six new faces […]
articles.title: Lawwell and Postecoglou ready to make double Celtic transfer before January – journalist

articles.description: Celtic will consider offers for right-back Josip Juranovic in the January transfer window, according to Stephen McGowan. The Lowdown: World Cup call-up The Croatian arrived in Glasgow last year and has gone on to make 50 appearances under Ange Postecoglou. The 27-year-old caught the eye of Premier League giants Chelsea and Manchester United over the […]
articles.title: Reliable reporter: Lawwell preparing to sell 'beautiful' Celtic ace after news in last 48 hours

articles.description:
ANGE POSTECOGLOU is to reject the proposal to join the Japan national team as head coach, a report from the Daily Record confirms. The paper implies they’ve spoken to someone within the club. The most interesting tidbit is the claim Ange has already knocked back offers of interest for other opportunities. In the early hours […]
The post Report: Ange Knocks Back Interest; Excited About Celtic Potential first appeared on Celts Are Here.

Source
articles.title: Report: Ange Knocks Back Interest; Excited About Celtic Potential

articles.description:
With the mid-season World Cup break now upon us, we can reflect on a start to the campaign that has been a whirlwind across the continent. On the domestic front, it’s very much been a period of dominance. Just one defeat from 15 has left the Bhoys nine points clear of second-placed Rangers, having already ...
The post Power Rankings 1-10: Celtic's best players this season, huge turnaround at #1 appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Power Rankings 1-10: Celtic's best players this season, huge turnaround at #1

articles.description: Earlier today, I wrote a piece on the Celtic By Numbers article which asks the deadly question about whether or not the SFA is lying to Celtic about the Jota decision. Alan Morrison, who runs that site, is not prone to exaggeration or hysteria. He cannot be called a conspiracy theorist by anyone credible because […]
articles.title: Ewan Cameron Is Talking Garbage About Celtic Fans And Paranoia.

articles.description:
It’s striking that this week Celtic, having already positioned themselves as the best side in the country by a distance, are hard at work while rival clubs, such as Rangers, take a break. Giovanni van Bronckhorst is reported to have returned to the Netherlands for some time off while former Ibrox player Kenny Miller has ...
The post As Rangers take time off Celtic are hard at work appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: As Rangers take time off Celtic are hard at work

articles.description:
CHRIS SUTTON has warned that Celtic can not get too comfortable in their push for the Scottish league title. As Ange Postecoglou and his bhoys travel to Australia to compete in the Sydney Super Cup, they hold a significant nine-point lead over their rivals, The Rangers. Despite the significant margin, Chris Sutton has warned that […]
The post Chris Sutton Pulls Up Robbie Savage Over Celtic Claim first appeared on Celts Are Here.

Source
articles.title: Chris Sutton Pulls Up Robbie Savage Over Celtic Claim

articles.description:
Celtic hero Josip Juranovic has given an interview to Croatian media ahead of the Qatar World Cup, making it clear he thinks his country can be a contender at the tournament. Croatia reached the final of the 2018 World Cup, seeing off Denmark, hosts Russia and England before losing 4-2 to France. Juranovic wasn’t involved ...
The post Celtic hero Josip Juranovic sets ambitious target in Croatian media appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Celtic hero Josip Juranovic sets ambitious target in Croatian media

articles.description: How comical it is tonight to read that Barry Ferguson is standing by his man. Standing by the manager he lauded so completely that he told the world of how he had Ange Postecoglou sussed, about how he had his tactics figured out. Actually, Ferguson’s support for Van Bronckhorst isn’t solid and it’s not unconditional. […]
articles.title: Barry Ferguson Still Can’t Bring Himself To Admit He Was Wrong About The Celtic Boss.

articles.description: Ange Postecoglou was asked by a fan whether he preferred Messi or Ronaldo and came up with a superb, yet very surprising answer. The boss is much loved for his straight talking remarks and candour in general by the fanbase, who have a special place in his heart.Likewise, the supporters have taken to Postecoglou arguably Read More
articles.title: “Jota mate,” Ange’s brilliant response to Messi or Ronaldo question

articles.description:
Brian Laudrup has questioned Rangers’ ability to raise the funds necessary to fund a full rebuild up against a surging Celtic under Ange Postecoglou. Scottish football gossip right now almost fully revolves around the crisis at Rangers and the future of under-fire manager Giovanni van Bronckhorst, who has become the scapegoat for all their current ...
The post Brian Laudrup makes stark Rangers finance admission; notes Celtic advantage with or without Gio appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Brian Laudrup makes stark Rangers finance admission; notes Celtic advantage with or without Gio

articles.description: James Young was born in the early hours of the morning at 15 Kirktonholme Street, Kilmarnock on January 10 1882 to William and Annie Young. Anne’s maiden surname was Gilmour, and sometimes Jimmy would sign official documents as James Gilmour Young, but his Birth Certificate definitely says that his name is James Young.His father William Read More
articles.title: Sunny Jim Young – Celtic Legend, Homesick in Bristol
